1. Create a layout file for the ListView item (e.g., list_item_layout.xml) with the desired UI elements to display the fields of the Income object.
2. Create a custom adapter class that extends ArrayAdapter<Income>.
3. Override the getView() method in the custom adapter class to inflate the layout file and populate the UI elements with the data from the Income object.
4. Set the custom adapter to the ListView using the Activity.setContentView method.

Here's an example implementation:

1. Create a layout file (list_item_layout.xml) with the following content:

```
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content"
    android:orientation="vertical">

    <TextView
        android:id="@+id/tutarTextView"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content" />

    <TextView
        android:id="@+id/kalemTextView"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content" />

</LinearLayout>
```

2. Create a custom adapter class (IncomeAdapter) that extends ArrayAdapter<Income>:

```
public class IncomeAdapter extends ArrayAdapter<Income> {

    public IncomeAdapter(Context context, ArrayList<Income> incomeList) {
        super(context, 0, incomeList);
    }

    @Override
    public View getView(int position, View convertView, ViewGroup parent) {
        // Get the data item for this position
        Income income = getItem(position);

        // Check if an existing view is being reused, otherwise inflate the view
        if (convertView == null) {
            convertView = LayoutInflater.from(getContext()).inflate(R.layout.list_item_layout, parent, false);
        }

        // Lookup UI elements within the layout
        TextView tutarTextView = convertView.findViewById(R.id.tutarTextView);
        TextView kalemTextView = convertView.findViewById(R.id.kalemTextView);

        // Populate the UI elements with the data from the Income object
        tutarTextView.setText(String.valueOf(income.getTutar()));
        kalemTextView.setText(income.getKalem());

        // Return the completed view to render on screen
        return convertView;
    }
}
```

3. In your activity, set the custom adapter to the ListView using the Activity.setContentView method:

```
sqliteHelper helper = new sqliteHelper(getApplicationContext());
ArrayList<Income> liste = helper.getAllIncome();

ListView listView = findViewById(R.id.listView);
IncomeAdapter adapter = new IncomeAdapter(this, liste);
listView.setAdapter(adapter);
```

Make sure to replace `R.layout.list_item_layout` with the actual resource ID of your layout file.

The getView() method is overridden to inflate a layout file (list_item_layout.xml) and populate the UI elements with the data from the Income object. The custom adapter is then set to the ListView using the Activity.setContentView method.
